byline.original: By JEFFREY GETTLEMAN, JAMES ESTRIN and DAVID FURST

abstract: Even though the south of Sudan has split from the north, the war is hardly over. Pete Muller was able to visit Blue Nile State, a restive area of Sudan, to provide a rare glimpse of the rebels who are now fighting to overthrow the government in Khartoum.
snippet: Even though the south of Sudan has split from the north, the war is hardly over. Pete Muller was able to visit Blue Nile State, a restive area of Sudan, to provide a rare glimpse of the rebels who are now fighting to overthrow the government in...
lead_paragraph: With shouts of "Freedom!" the people of South Sudan celebrated their newly won independence on July 9. After a decades-long civil war, the rebels of the Sudan People's Liberation Army  who had battled the government of Omar Hassan al-Bashir could savor their success.

headline.main: From Sudan, a Glimpse of a New Conflict
